argumentText:
ARGUMENT

| Step | Hyp | Ref | Expression |
|---|---|---|---|

| 1 |  | ixxssxr.1 | |- O = ( x e. RR* , y e. RR* |-> { z e. RR* | ( x R z /\ z S y ) } ) |
| 2 | 1 | #P_elmpt2cl | |- ( x e. ( A O B ) -> ( A e. RR* /\ B e. RR* ) ) |
| 3 | 1 | #P_ixxf | |- O : ( RR* X. RR* ) --> ~P RR* |
| 4 | 3 | #P_fovcl | |- ( ( A e. RR* /\ B e. RR* ) -> ( A O B ) e. ~P RR* ) |
| 5 | 4 | #P_elpwid | |- ( ( A e. RR* /\ B e. RR* ) -> ( A O B ) C_ RR* ) |
| 6 | 5 | #P_sseld | |- ( ( A e. RR* /\ B e. RR* ) -> ( x e. ( A O B ) -> x e. RR* ) ) |
| 7 | 2, 6 | #P_mpcom | |- ( x e. ( A O B ) -> x e. RR* ) |
| 8 | 7 | #P_ssriv | |- ( A O B ) C_ RR* |
\
 The set of intervals of extended reals maps to subsets of extended reals.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 4-Jul-2014.)
